Below is an outline of all the 
tests	that	can	be	offered.
Your blood group and 
rhesus factor
Your blood will be tested to 
check your blood group and 
to see whether you are rhesus 
negative or positive. Some 
women are rhesus negative. 
This is usually not a worry for a 
first	pregnancy	but	it	may	affect	
the next child.
People who are rhesus positive 
have a substance known as 
D antigen on the surface of 
their red blood cells. Rhesus 
negative people do not.
